fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently the expected behavior of the 'Recent Boards', under the 'Boards' main menu is not documented. Therefore it may cause confusion as to if this is displaying recent boards that have been accessed recently in the instance and the user has permission to view this board 

Or 

If this should display the recent boards that the particular user who has logged-in last accessed

Document this behavior so this is clear to the users.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
We are using your [pocketknife library|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-pocketknife-querydsl/src/master/] in our marketplace apps and love it!

The issue now is the [license.txt|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-pocketknife-querydsl/src/master/LICENSE.txt] of pocketknife is linked to  http://www.atlassian.com/end-user-agreement but this is now a redirection link to the Atlassian cloud terms. These terms won't match to such code as is there written that we need to create our own license contract with each customer. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Check out atlassian-pocketknife-querydsl [license.txt|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-pocketknife-querydsl/src/master/LICENSE.txt]. 

h3. Expected Results
Points to the proper, server-related, licensing terms

h3. Actual Results
http://www.atlassian.com/end-user-agreement in the license.txt redirects to Atlassian Cloud Terms of Service

h3. Notes
* Is there a way to apply another license type there that fits open source?

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Incorrect license.txt for pocketknife-querydsl

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Copying and pasting an image file using Jira's visual editor won't add the file to the Description or comment field of an issue

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Select a file and use COMMAND+C (on a Mac) to copy a file
# Edit an issue's Description or comment field and use COMMAND+V to paste the file into the field

h3. Observation

h5. Using the Text Editor
* When the steps to reproduce are followed using Jira's text editor, you are prompted to Attach a Screenshot: 
!attach.png|thumbnail!
* The image is also added to the text comment as: \!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail\! 

h5. Using the Visual Editor
* The image filename is added as text
* The image is neither attached to the issue nor added to the Description or comment field using the visual editor
* If you copy the image directly from an image viewing or editing program and past it into the Description or comment field, the image is both attached and added to the field. 

h3. Expected Results

* When pasting an image file into the Description or comment field using the visual editor the image is attached to the issue and added to the comment:
!visual attach.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

* The image filename is added as text
* The image is neither attached to the issue nor added to the Description or comment field using the visual editor:
!visual.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

* Use the attachment button from the Description or comment header to attach the image file:
!attachment.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Copying and pasting an image file using Jira's visual editor won't add the file to the Description or comment field of an issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When attempting to import issues from Bitbucket into Jira Server you are presented with a 500 error after clicking on the Bitbucket icon.
h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
 *Jira server 8.2.3
 *Bitbucket Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Within Jira, Select Projects > Import External Project
 # Select Bitbucket from the option
 # You will be presented with a 500 error

h3. Expected Results

The issues from Bitbucket should be imported.
h3. Actual Results

The following output is displayed:
h1. Sorry, we had some technical problems during your last operation.
h2. Request assistance
Copy the content below and send it to your Jira Administrator
{code}
Technical details

Log's referral number: *800f689e-9a02-4738-9211-1fc71ecdc751*

Cause

Referer URL: *Unknown*
 org.scribe.exceptions.OAuthConnectionException: There was a problem while creating a connection to the remote service.
...
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: This is not a JSON Array.
{code}

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround.

fields.description:
Summary:

Bulk edition grabs the last JQL result, even if it is triggered on a older page using an older JQL filter.

Steps to reproduce:

# Open a web page.
# Perform a JQL filter.
# Open a new web page.
# Perform a JQL filter.
# Perform a bulk edit on the first opened web page.
# The bulk edit will bring up the results of the second JQL filter.

Reproducible on Version: 7.6.11
fields.summary: Bulk Edition is done with the last URL opened.

fields.description:
In many cases, we need to have multiple scrum boards for the same project. And we still want them to share the same sprint schedule (ie. the same Sprint set).

Now, from one board, you can create a new Sprint, this sprint is assumed to be for all the boards within the same project. But going to the other board, you may or may not see the new Sprint, if none of the stories there are tagged with the sprint.

The suggestion is to add a button next to Create Sprint in Backlog board, say Add Existing Sprint.

Clicking on this new button Add Existing Sprints, you can see a list of available Sprints (not closed one) and pick those you want to be seen in the board. And these sprints will be shown in the board for users to drag stories in
fields.summary: Allow adding existing Sprint to a board, instead of just Creating new sprint

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When trying to export SLA values to Excel after disabling the Dark feature sd.sla.improved.rendering.enabled to revert the SLA rendering format (as explained on [How To Revert The SLA Rendering Improvement Changes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-revert-the-sla-rendering-improvement-changes-943970007.html]), Microsoft Excel displays #VALUE! for negative SLA values. This does not happen on OpenOffice.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Follow the workaround suggested in this article: [How To Revert The SLA Rendering Improvement Changes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-revert-the-sla-rendering-improvement-changes-943970007.html]
# Try to export SLA values using the Excel export option through the Issue Navigator
# Check that the negative SLA values are displayed as #VALUE!

Since Atlassian provides a workaround to disable the new rendering, Jira should be able to export the negative SLA numbers in a proper way as well.
fields.summary: Improve how Jira exports SLA values to Excel when having the improved SLA rendering disabled

fields.description: Currently only system admins can set the notification scheme for a project. Project admins should be able to change the notification scheme as well as modify it to their projects liking. System admins shouldn't have to create a custom notification scheme for every project that wants one and I don't know any two projects in my company that want the same notification scheme. Project admins should be able to get the notifications they want, when they want them, and shouldn't have to rely on system admins to set that up for them.
fields.summary: Project Admins Should be able to Modify Notification Scheme

fields.description: Our company has various groups that use Jira and each of them requires different roles for their workflows. Would be nice to have the ability to limit what roles are visible in different projects so that teams don't get confused about what each role means. We have over 3000 users, so training each of them on the roles and expecting them to remember is ridiculous especially as new roles continue to be added to our growing Jira server.
fields.summary: Project Roles should not be global

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Email address having '+' signs are not rendered correctly in text Custom Field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field of type Text Field (single line) and add this field to issue view screen.
# By default renderer for this custom field is 'Default Text Renderer'.
# Now if you add an email address that has a plus sign, the text before '+' sign is not rendered correctly as can be seen in the screenshot:
 !image-2019-07-09-23-23-14-538.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The email link should be rendered correctly with '+' sign.

h3. Actual Results
The email link is not rendered correctly.


h3. Notes
Able to replicate this behavior on JIRA 8.2.2. 

h3. Workaround
# Change the renderer from 'Default Text Renderer' to 'Wiki Style Renderer' for the custom field.
# Add email in the below format and save:
{code} [mailto:emailaddress] {code}
# The email is rendered correctly even with '+' sign.
(!) This workaround is not helpful in scenarios where the field is getting populated from a plugin as you cannot change the format in which value in entered in the custom field.
fields.summary: Email address having '+' signs are not rendered correctly in text Custom Field.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding a workflow properties added in a non-latin alphabet will result on the workflow property not being able to be deleted.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Head to a workflow.
 # On any status, click on *Properties*.
 # Add a workflow property that include a non-latin alphabet such as 'Feldauflösung umfassen' in the Property Key and Value. Click on *Add*.
 # Click on *Delete* to try to delete the workflow property.

h3. Expected Results

The workflow property will be deleted.
h3. Actual Results

The workflow property will not be deleted.
h3. Workaround
 # [Export your Workflow as XML|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/sharing-your-workflow-938847433.html].
 # Open the workflow in the text editor, search for the workflow property. Then, save the XML file.
 # [Import the XML workflow|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/using-xml-to-create-a-workflow-938847525.html] into Jira.
 # [Associate the Workflow to the project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/managing-your-workflows-776636587.html].
fields.summary: Adding workflow properties that include non-latin alphabets will result in the workflow properties not being able to be deleted.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Every time Jira 8.2.2 is started up, there would be a line in the logs that show:
{code}
2019-07-09 17:54:12,569 JIRA-Bootstrap INFO      [c.a.jira.index.ObsoleteIndexCleaner] Purging F:\Program Files\Atlassian\Application Data\JIRAGHS-155969\caches\indexes - index file not compatible with Lucene 7.x
{code}

h3. Environment
Jira 8.2.2 that was updated from Jira 7.9.2. (needs to be validated)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Jira 7.9.2.
# Populate Jira 7.9.2 with some issues, and run a re-index.
# Update Jira 7.9.2 -> Jira 8.2.2
# Startup Jira 8.2.2.
# The following lines would be observed:
{code}
2019-07-09 17:45:00,453 JIRA-Bootstrap INFO      [c.a.jira.index.ObsoleteIndexCleaner] Purging F:\Program Files\Atlassian\Application Data\JIRAGHS-155969\caches\indexes - index file not compatible with Lucene 7.x
{code}
# Restart Jira 8.2.2.
# Again, the logs would show:
{code}
2019-07-09 17:48:40,685 JIRA-Bootstrap INFO      [c.a.jira.index.ObsoleteIndexCleaner] Purging F:\Program Files\Atlassian\Application Data\JIRAGHS-155969\caches\indexes - index file not compatible with Lucene 7.x
{code}

h3. Expected Results
It should only show that the old indexes are purged once.

h3. Actual Results
Every startup, would show a line that says the indexes are purged.

h3. Workaround
Jira tries to delete old Index folder during each start. It's safe to ignore the logging message.
fields.summary: Every start up of Jira 8 shows "Purging JIRA_HOME\caches\indexes - index file not compatible with Lucene 7.x" in the logs.

fields.description: As a user of Jira (non-Cloud) I cannot influence the date format.  My OS (Win10) setting is yyyy-MM-dd while Jira displays dd/MMM/yy.  As I understand this setting is Jira-wide and unavailable to an individual User.  Since the Jira WebUI isn't using the OS setting, can this be made User settable in eg. Profile -> Preferences.
fields.summary: Make Date format User settable

fields.description: As a Jira admin, I'd like to be able to customize the footer and change the Atlassian logo URL from http to https.
fields.summary: As a Jira admin, I'd like to be able to customize the Atlassian logo URL at the footer

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a board creator is removed from the only group given Editor permission, the user loses the 'Add gadget' and 'Edit layout' buttons on the dashboard.
 The user can still edit the dashboard by browsing to Dashboards -> Manage Dashboards, but this causes confusion to users who are not familiar the multiple ways a dashboard can be modified.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login as a non-admin user and create a dashboard (notice the 'Add gadget' and 'Edit layout' buttons at the top of the dashboard)
 # Add the user to a group
 # Edit the board to provide Editor permissions to the group
 # Remove the user from the group
 # Login as the board creator user and browse to the dashboard (notice the 'Add gadget' and 'Edit layout' buttons are missing)
 # As the board creator user, browse to Dashboards -> Manage dashboards page -> click the cog to the right of the dashboard -> click Edit
 # Remove the group from the Editors section
 # Browse back to the dashboard and notice the 'Add gadget' and 'Edit layout' buttons return

h3. Expected Results

A board creator should never lose the 'Add gadget' and 'Edit layout' buttons.
h3. Actual Results

A board creator can lose access to the buttons until the unassociated group is removed.
h3. Workaround

As the dashboard creator, browse to Dashboards -> Manage dashboards page -> click the cog to the right of the dashboard -> click Edit -> and...
# remove all groups from the Viewers and Editors sections, *OR*
# add the dashboard owner to the groups in these sections.
fields.summary: When a board creator is removed from the only group given Editor permission, the user loses the 'Add gadget' and 'Edit layout' buttons on the dashboard.

fields.description:
When the number of Issue types, screens and custom fields grows up, their administration views are becoming a mess. 

Categorizing, classifying them could facilitate searching them for editing.

 

example : i would create 25 new transitions screens for one configuration Scheme. Later, i want to find them easily, not struggling looking for each one of them in the middle of 150 other screens.
fields.summary: Categorizing Issue Types, Screens and Custom Fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

German keyboard doesn't cancel comment form with current keyboard shortcut "Modifier key(s) + ` (backquote)". This is because following shortcut is a "dead key" on German keyboard
h3. Suggestion to use "Escape" key as alternative.
h3. Environment

Jira Server
h3. Expected Results

Keyboard shortcut able to cancel comment form.
h3. Actual Results

Unable to cancel comment form. As shortcut key "Modifier key(s) + ` (backquote)" is dead key on German keyboard.

 
h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state:
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: German keyboard doesn't cancel comment form with current keyboard shortcut "Modifier key(s) + ` (backquote)"

fields.description: Currently when a user is created the user_name is used for most mapping in Jira. It would be better to have a unique id created that is used instead to make sure it's truly unique.
fields.summary: When users are created they should use a unique id.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When in visual mode, after mentioning a user such as -
{code}
'@'user will link a file
{code}
The user will go to link a file that had been uploaded prior, the file link will append next to the mentioned name instead of the end of the sentence even if the cursor was at the end for example -
{code}
'@'userfilename will link a file
{code}


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attach a non-image to a ticket.
# In the ticket go to add a comment using Visual mode.
# type a sentence and at mention a user in a sentence.
# At the end of the sentence use the drop down attachment to add the file
 !attachment.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Attachment is appended wherever the cursor is.

h3. Actual Results
Attachment is appended right next to the at mention user's name.
 !appendedattachment.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Switch to text editor to link the attachment then switch back to visual mode.
fields.summary: Attachment link appends next to '@'mentions in rich text editor

fields.description:
h5. Summary

There's currently no way to tell where an issue is created from (within a board or through the create button, for example).

h5. Suggestion

It would be great if there was any type of modifier that would allow for specific actions to be taken based on where the issue is created from.
fields.summary: Provide a modifier based on where an issue is created from
Importing CSV create additional packages in the Logging and Profiling page

fields.description:
h3. Details
[SSL for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211087/ssl-for-jira?hosting=server&tab=overview] is an Atlassian Labs plugin and currently (as of July 4th, 2019) its latest compatible Jira version is 8.0.2.

fields.description:
Hi! 

 

As in the title, I would suggest implementing the option to manually set security levels for chosen issues. So, in one project - containing multiple groups of employees, I would be able to limit some groups access to particular tasks.
fields.summary: Issue-level security in Next-Gen projects

fields.description: Often we need to share 'Quick Filters' across several boards and projects. The ability to reference an existing saved JQL filter rather than always crafting a new one would be very helpful, and allow us to manage changes in one place (ie. new person temporarily joins the team).
fields.summary: Make shared filters available as 'Quick Filters' on project boards

fields.description:
The documentation for JQL searches states that only the CONTAINS operator ** is valid for the *text* field. Later in the documentation, it list ** and *!~* as valid operators.

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/advanced-searching-fields-reference-939938743.html#Advancedsearching-fieldsreference-textTextText]

*~!* is not a valid operator for the *text* field in a JQL search.

 

*Suggested change*

The line which currently reads as follows:
{noformat}The text master-field can only be used with the CONTAINS operator ("~" and "!~").
{noformat}
Should be modified to read as this:
{noformat}The text master-field can only be used with the CONTAINS operator ("~").
{noformat}
!image-2019-07-03-15-14-07-230.png|width=534,height=680!
fields.summary: JQL 'text' valid operators (CONTAINS ~) inconsistent on documentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When clicking on a card in the backlog of Jira 8+ the card is slow to change state (XHRReadyStateChange) so that it can be moved. The response becomes slower relative to the number of cards in the backlog, but can be replicated with about 100 cards.
h3. Environment

Jira 8, Chrome 75. This can not be replicated in any other browser.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Software project.
 # Create 100+ issues in the backlog.
 # Navigate to the board > backlog.
 # Attempt to click a card and rank it.

h3. Expected Results

The card can be moved immediately.
h3. Actual Results

There is a delay between the click and the time that card can be 'picked up' and dragged to a new location.
h3. Notes
 * Observing the network traffic in the browser, the GET request to URL [http://localhost/contextpath/rest/greenhopper/1.0/xboard/issue/details.json?rapidViewId=1&issueIdOrKey=BLAH-32&loadSubtasks=true&_=1562013311017] is slow.
 * A screen recording of the behavior can be viewed here: [https://cl.ly/b83d71cde59c/Screen%252520Recording%2525202019-07-01%252520at%25252002.54%252520PM.mov]

h3. Workaround

Use a browser other than Chrome.
fields.summary: Moving a card in the backlog is slow in Chrome 75

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When viewing an issue in the Issue Navigator, clicking a multi-text box will lead to a display error in Edge. The upper navigation bar is hidden and a gray box is displayed at the bottom of the page. 
 
h3. Environment
* Browser : Edge
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open JIRA in Edge.
 # Click "Issues" and "Search for issues"
 # Search for some issues
 # Open an issue in detail view
 # Click in a multi-line text box containing text

h3. Expected Results
Issue is displayed correctly.

h3. Actual Results
Issue is displayed with the upper navigation bar is hidden and a gray box is displayed at the bottom of the page. 
!image-2019-07-03-22-42-05-314.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
The issue can be fixed by going back to the previous page before the bug occurs or by restarting the browser.

You can also use other browsers as another option.
fields.summary: When viewing an issue in the Issue Navigator, clicking a multi-text box will lead to a display error in Edge.
The (Confluence Wiki) Markup is painful to use and rather unpredictable

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It appears that deploying the JIRA Data Center Quickstart template below will cause a Gadget Feed URL if 0.0.0.0/0 is not used as its CIDR Block. This will also cause loading the Dashboard really slow:
- https://aws.amazon.com/quickstart/architecture/jira/

h3. Steps to Replicate.
# Deploy a JIRA Data Center instance using the quickstart template above (Software/Service Desk)
# Set the "Trusted" and "Permitted" IP Range to anything beside Public Access(0.0.0.0/0).
# Go through the Wizard and let the instance deploy.
# Access the Load Balancer URL from the Cloud Formation Template Output and login to the dashboard, also the Support Tool page with the following:
{code}<JIRA Load Balancer URL>/plugins/servlet/troubleshooting/view/{code}

h3. Expected Results.
- The dashboard will load and health check will report that everything is ok.

h3. Actual Results.
- The dashboard will load really slow and the health check will complain about "Gadget Feed URL"

h3. Note
The suspected issue here is that the JIRA unable to reach to itself through the Load Balancer like the following article:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-fix-gadget-titles-showing-as-__msg_gadget-813697086.html

In case that the configured CIDR Block still did not allow the access to JIRA Administration Page, for easier access, add an Inbound Rule "My IP" for HTTP to the Security Group.

h3. Workaround.
At the moment, the problem will not happen if the Security Groups(Inbound) are set to accept 0.0.0.0/0 which is public access.
fields.summary: Gadget Feed URL Problem on JIRA Data Center AWS Quickstart
Restore from Cloud to Server fails with mismatched data type error on columns PROJECT.ID and AO_2C4E5C_MAILWHITELISTS.PROJECT_ID

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When trying to complete a Sprint, a new pop-up will show with a scroll bar on the right side, even though the whole text already fits in the pop-up.

h3. Steps to reproduce

Issue Reproduced on JIRA 8.1.0 using Chrome as a browser

- Create a new SCRUM project in JIRA Software
- Go to the backlog view and Create a new Sprint, including issues that haven't been closed yet
- Open the Sprint page, and click on the "Complete Sprint" link: a new window will pop-up letting you know that some issues were complete
- There is no scrollbar at this point
- Mouse over this pop-up window, and try to scroll up and down: you'll see a scroll bar that appears on the right side of the pop-up, even though the whole text fits in the window
 !Screen Shot 2019-07-03 at 2.15.21 PM.png|thumbnail! 

 
h3. Suggested Solution

Add an option to remove the scroll bar from the Complete Screen window
fields.summary: Add an option to remove the scroll bar from the Complete Screen window

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Project Administrator Permission (even extended) will not allow Project Admins to change the Schemes in the project.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the Extended Project Administrator to make changes to the Schemes in the project. Such schemes should be :
* Issue Type Scheme
* Issue Type Screen Scheme
* Field Configuration Scheme
* Workflow Scheme

This should allow for more flexibility and granular control on the Administration between the JIRA Application and Projects.

h3. Workaround 
JIRA Admins will need to make the Scheme changes in Projects
fields.summary: Allow Extended Project Administrator Project Permission to change schemes in the project

fields.description:

The word "Type" in english, could mean in portuguese "Digite" ou "Tipo".

In this context, it should be "Tipo", once we ar not asking for the user to type anything.

We just mean the type of the issue.

!image-2019-07-02-11-18-58-126.png!
fields.summary: Weird Portuguese Translations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When user using IME for Japanese Input, Split issue submit incomplete issue while inputting.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to backlog
# Right-click the issue and select Split issue
# Input Japanese with IME
# Press "Enter" key to finalize composition

h3. Expected Results
Submit should work only while not composing.

h3. Actual Results
Submit incomplete issue while inputting.

h3. Workaround
Press "Add another" before input Japanese. Required validation prevent to submit with enter key.
fields.summary: IME enter key work as a submit in Split issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently when we start a sprint, we can populate any start and end dates. We can also edit those dates anytime. We need a way we can add/store those dates somewhere in the board or project or admin panel so that user can only select those dates as start and end dates of the sprint.

h3. Description
Basically, whenever we start a sprint in a scrum board, we have to enter sprint start and end dates. We would like to have an ability to store those dates and use them while starting a sprint. Currently, a user can select his own sprint start and end dates via calendar. These dates can also be updated anytime. We would like to restrict this feature and allow user to select sprint schedules as planned by the enterprise. This will allow users to select sprint start and end dates from the list of dates defined by the enterprise only and hence remove the random selection of dates.
fields.summary: Add the ability of restricting the possible Start and End Dates of sprints in a board

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Nowadays, users are more and more using add-ons to complement Jira functionalities, for site-admins it's tough to know if the add-ons is being widely used or if the project it was used for has been finished and thus the add-ons is not required anymore.

h3. Suggestion

Implement an analytic for Jira admins to follow add-ons usage by endusers.

This is similar to the functionality already provided by Confluence Cloud - Macro Usage.

With such functionality as the above site-admins would be able to manage their sites bills more easily.
fields.summary: Provide analytics for add-ons usage across Jira Server
Audit log for change to Status configuration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The *Comment added* filter in Activity Stream gadget is counting status changes as comments and displaying them in the activity stream. This is causing user confusion since if for example a bulk status change is performed, the activity stream will show what appears as a random list of issues as the latest to be commented on while they don't actually have new comments.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Edit* in the *Activity Stream* gadget
# Create a filter that is *Activity* *is* *Comment added*
# Go to any issue and change the status (without adding a comment)

h3. Expected Results
Activity Stream should remain unchanged

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Comment added" filter in Activity Stream gadget is also triggering on status changes

fields.description: Links in the issue description needs another color and be underlined. They are invisible now. Not good, easy to miss.
fields.summary: Links in the issue description needs to stand out

fields.description: When we search for Component in Advanced JQL search, it autopopulates with all components from all projects, rather than with components belonging to selected projects in the same JQL query. This is is contrast to the behavior of Simple JQL search where Component field only contains entries from selected projects, so in that sense, Advanced search is "dumber" as compared to Simple search.
fields.summary: Make Component autopopulate in Advanced JQL search project-aware

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Searching of custom fields in the *ViewCustomFields.jspa* page is slow. It can take 30+ seconds to filter the results of the searched fields.

h3. Environment
* Jira 7.12+
* 1500 custom fields
* 6000 screens

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to ViewCustomFields.jspa page
# Search for a custom field

h3. Expected Results
The results of the filtered custom field return quickly 

h3. Actual Results
The results of the filtered custom field take a long time (30+ seconds) to return the custom field

h3. Notes
The searching for the custom field will have the REST API {{/rest/api/2/customFields}} to iterate over screens of each custom fields. 

h3. Workaround
Perform spring cleaning to try and reduce
* the total number of custom fields
* the total number of screens

h3. Note on Fix
The number of operations needed to perform the search has been reduced by avoiding obtaining a list of all screen fields for each custom field.
fields.summary: Searching of Custom fields in ViewCustomFields Page is slow

fields.description:
As an admin of Jira, it would be very useful for a manager to be able to have certain fields always preselected for a user when they select the "Configure fields" button in a Jira issue screen. This would allow for a manager or administrator to keep certain fields in a user's screen initially without having all fields displayed.

The only workaround right now is to make a field required, but some user's would prefer to still keep these fields as optional while making sure they are automatically checked to show in "Configure fields".
fields.summary: Allow for admin configuration of preselected "Configure fields" buttons

fields.description: We would like to have a way to run a report on a project for all issue transitions. The report would include the issue number, previous status, new status, and date/time of the transition. We want to change the ordering of the report between chronologically and issue number. Currently, there is no way to generate a report of this type for an entire project from the UI, only for individual issues.
fields.summary: Issue Transition Report

fields.description: x
fields.summary: Enable preview of txt files in Jira

fields.description:
h2. Actual Behavior:
 - In the Agile board configuration, Column management, I can select a column constraint from the following options:
## None
## Issue Count
## Issue Count, excluding sub-tasks

h2. Expected Behavior:
- There should be fourth option "Only sub-tasks"

h2. Context
Our main working items after Planning 2 are sub-tasks we have created with the whole team. Each sub-tasks should be a maximum of 1 day effort. I as a scrum master want to restrict the number of open sub-tasks using the WIP limit. The problem is, that also the stories will count in. To work around that, we keep the story {{OPEN}} until we have resolved all sub-tasks an then also resolve the Story. That has the disadvantage that we cannot calculate cycle time for stories.
fields.summary: Exclude Stories from WIP Limit

fields.description: As an administrator of the product, I believe it would be useful to be able to pull information on current mail servers via Jira's API. This would allow for further setup of server automation behind the scenes and allow for a much easier way to pull this information in real time.
fields.summary: Create API Call to Get Mail Server Information

fields.description:
Instead of having to create a project per person for them to manage day-to-day non-project tasks, or do it in another tool, how about a personal & private task list & kanban board?

Another person on twitter suggested creating a single project shared with everyone but having issue security limit visibility of issues to only assignee/reporter.

This suggestion applies to all version of Jira - Core and Software.
fields.summary: "Personal" issues + Kanban board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Value of date picker custom field contains date and time when exported to .csv format
h3. Environment

Jira Server
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Export value of date picker type custom field to .csv format
 # The date picker type custom field in .csv file would contain date and time 26/06/2019 12:00am (has default time as 00:00am)

h3. Expected Results

The date picker type custom field should only contain date when exported .csv format.
h3. Actual Results

The date picker type custom field in .csv file contains date and time 26/06/2019 12:00am (has default time as 00:00am)
h3. Notes

The date picker type custom field contains date only if exported  to excel format
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Value of date picker type custom field contains date and time when exported to .csv format

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira recognizes space behind the text for Fix Versions, Component/s, Filter & Dashboard name.
h3. Environment

Jira Software
h3. Steps to Reproduce for Fix Versions
 # Navigate to Jira Software Project > Releases
 # Create version with a space behind the text (eg: "3.12 "
 # Add version and apply the fix version to issue
 # Navigate to issue navigator and place the following JQL (project = test AND fixVersion = "3.12 ")
 # Jira will display the issues with the following fix version with "space"
 # If space is removed JQL (project = test AND fixVersion = "3.12"), issues are not reflected

h3. Steps to Reproduce for Filter name.
 # Navigate to Issues > Search issues
 # Create a JQL and save filter as "alpha " (with a space)
 # Search for filter JQL *filter = "alpha"* (without space)
 # Error message *The value 'alpha' does not exist for the field 'filter'.*

h3. Expected Results

Jira should not recognizes space behind the text for Fix Versions, Component/s, Filter & Dashboard name. (This may cause error)
h3. Actual Results

Jira recognizes space behind the text for Fix Versions, Component/s, Filter & Dashboard name.
h3. Workaround
 # Remove space in Fix Versions, Component/s, Filter & Dashboard name.
 # Adjust filters accordingly to the new value.
fields.summary: Jira recognizes space behind the text for Fix Versions/Component/s/ Filter & Dashboard name

fields.description:
There is a customer use case where they would like to configure a given Jira Software project to integrate with only 1 Development tool, eg: Bitbucket server with Project "A", while to be able to configure another project "B" to integrate only with Github.
Project "B" shouldn't show any commits from Bitbucket, Project "A" shouldn't show any commits from Github.

Currently there is no way to control which project is integrated with which tool, this applies on tools linked using Application Links and tools connected using DVCS plugin.
All Jira Software projects are linked with all tool defined on the Jira instance.

The above scenario is also not covered by configuring Dev panel permissions.
The Dev panel permission either allows every thing to be shown to the user on the panel or every thing to be hidden from the user.

The configuration could be either through project permissions or using project settings.
fields.summary: Allow Jira software project integration with Devtools to be configurable

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When an image attachment is added to a Jira issue the image preview of the uploaded file are not always displaying color accurate versions of the original file
h3. Environment
 * Tested against Jira 7.13.1 and 8.1.0, but I suspect this affects many more older versions of Jira as well.
 * Tested again Chrome and Firefox browsers with same results.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # upload a sample image like the one attached  [^orig.png]
 # Use a color picker tool to examine the red color of the displayed thumbnail of that image OR
 # Click on that uploaded file to go into the preview mode, to examine the red color in that preview

h3. Expected Results

Expecting that these previews will display an RGB color value of 255,0,0 for the large red section of that original image
h3. Actual Results

The large red area of those previews is actually RGB value of 252,13,27
h3. Notes
 * The original uploaded file can still be downloaded and that download file has the correct colors.
 * the thumbnail file created by Jira also has the correct color value for red in this case
 * this leads me to believe that the problem is being caused by the way those image attachments (and thumbnails) are being displayed within the issue detail view on the page.
 * This problem extends to both the preview itself (when you click on the image in Jira), and the thumbnail as it is displayed in a Jira issue (not the actual thumbnail file stored in the $jirahome/data/attachments/\{projectkey}/\{issuekey}/thumbs/ directory, just the image displayed on the issue itself.)

h3. Workaround

There currently is no work-around to this behavior of the image preview.
fields.summary: Previewing images attached to Jira issues show inaccurate color values when compared to the original and thumbnails

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In our environment, we have a PostgreSQL DB hosted within a dedicated Enterprise Compose Cluster. This cluster provides two different portal access connection strings.

As dbconfig.xml only allows for one connection, when the link to the database goes down, Jira cannot change to the other database connection automatically.
h3. Suggested Solution

We would like for Jira to be able to detect and switch portals automatically if one connection string fails.

This functionality will dramatically enhance enterprise data center environments by providing a native high availability functionality when connected to hosted enterprise databases such as Compose PostgreSQL.
fields.summary: As an admin, allow for multiple database connection strings and to switch over when one fails.

fields.description: You have StartOf functions for all other time units. Why not this one? Lots of business reports are done quarterly. It would be very useful to be able to easily say "last quarter." With this function, it would be easy.
fields.summary: Add a StartOfQuarter() function to JQL

fields.description:
# There should be a way to link a Jira Project to a SPECIFIC Bitbucket repository.
 # When creating a new branch from within Jira, it should ONLY be possible to create a new branch in that SPECIFIC repository. It should not be possible to create a new branch in any other repo. At the very least, make it a configurable option. It would also be helpful to follow/support the repo branching model
 # There should also be a way to link a Jira Issue to a SPECIFIC repo AND branch.  Maybe support multiple repo/branch links, but it should be possible to limit it to 1.
fields.summary: Link Jira Project to a Specific Bitbucket Repository

fields.description:
When you're using AWS simple e-mail service, there's a limit of sending 50 e-mails per batch. Using the bulk send e-mail feature, it won't batch / queue these messages so selecting more than 50 users will result in an error. 

As Atlassian is pushing AWS as a hosting platform for Jira Server / Jira Data Center, this should be fixed.
fields.summary: Bulk mail sender should batch e-mails

fields.description:
There was a server-side template injection vulnerability in Jira Server and Data Center, in the ContactAdministrators and the SendBulkMail actions. For this issue to be exploitable at least one of the following conditions must be met:
 * an SMTP server has been configured in Jira and the Contact Administrators Form is enabled; or
 * an SMTP server has been configured in Jira and an attacker has "JIRA Administrators" access.

In the first case, where the Contact Administrators Form is enabled, attackers are able to exploit this issue without authentication. In the second case, attackers with "JIRA Administrators" access can exploit this issue. In either case, successful exploitation of this issue allows an attacker to remotely execute code on systems that run a vulnerable version of Jira Server or Data Center.



*Affected versions:*
 * All versions of Jira Server and Data Center from 4.4.0 before 7.6.14, from 7.7.0 before 7.13.5, from 8.0.0 before 8.0.3, from 8.1.0 before 8.1.2, and from 8.2.0 before 8.2.3 are affected by this vulnerability.


*Fix:*
 We have released the following versions of Jira Server & Jira Data Center to address this issue:
 * 8.2.3 which is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/download].
 * 8.1.2 which is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/update].
 * 8.0.3 which is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/update].
 * 7.13.5 which is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/update].
 * 7.6.14 which is available for download from [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/update].

 

For additional details, see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/AzoGOg].
fields.summary: CVE-2019-11581 - Template injection in various resources

fields.description:
If there are multiple files with long file names attached, if the filenames are similar, there is no way to differentiate the files in the attachment drop down list without selecting it first.

The drop down list should display a tooltip that shows the full filename when the user mouseover each file to help user identify which file is which.

 !image-2019-06-26-12-02-08-157.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Long filename in attachment drop down list is truncated

fields.description:
Hi


We deal with external client and would like to hide certain tickets on a ticket by ticket basis. Currently there is permissions for project level or type level. I would like to see a public or private issue type so only certain groups can view these tickets.
fields.summary: As an JIRA admin I would like to restrict the ability to view certain issue tickets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Quick search doesn't return any values, unless you press enter.

h3. Environment
JIRA 8.1.0, 7,13,3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new ticket
 # Type in the ticket number example CD12345
# Nothing is returned and displays no results.
# Press enter now ticket shows.

h3. Expected Results
Ticket displayed in quick search.

h3. Actual Results
Quick search returned "*no results*"

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Quick search returns no results, unless you press enter.

fields.description:
With JRASERVER-24547 it's now possible to drag and drop subtasks on the View Issue screen. However this is not possible in the Backlog issue detail view on Scrum/Kanban boards.

The same functionality to move the subtasks up or down with a drag and drop feature should be available on the Issue Detail View – it's possible to reorder the subtasks directly on an active sprint board or Kanban board but not within the detail view. Having a drag and drop feature would allow for quicker organization of the subtasks.
fields.summary: Drag and Drop Subtasks in the Issue Detail View on Agile Boards

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
Sometimes it is beneficial to have a summary of project configurations, e.g. which schemas and configurations are being used with a project or being shared among projects.

h3. Suggested resolution
Please implement a report which we could use to create such summary.
fields.summary: Report on project configurations

fields.description:
*Suggestion*
It would be great if the "Update Issue Field" post function that comes with Jira is enhanced to include the feature of updating a field value from another chosen field's value. While there are third-party plugins that achieve this, we would prefer if the solution comes built-in with Jira.
fields.summary: Post function to copy a value of a field to another

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Issue collector breaks after upgrade to 8.1.1.

h3. Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upgrade to 8.1.1
 # Issue collector breaks.

h3. Expected Results
Either in the release notes a warning that you have to update the issue collector after an upgrade or some warning.

h3. Actual Results
Java script code portion of our Issue Collectors changed so we had to update the HTML for all instances using Issue Collectors.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Upgrade Jira 7.11.2 to 8.1.1 breaks Issue collector.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the JIRA instance has some broken Application Links, it will not be loaded instantly when accessing *Administration > System > Application Links* page. This will cause users to think that the Application Links do not exist in the instance. Waiting on the page for several minutes will allow the broken Application Link to be displayed.

Due to the broken Application Links, it will cause some problem where the Issue Create screen will take few minutes to close and creates duplicate issues in the background.

h3. Expected Results
All Application Links will be loaded instantly and issues created will not have duplicates.

h3. Actual Results
Broken Application Links will take few minutes to be displayed and created issue screen will also take few minutes to be closed and duplicate issues are created.

h3. Workaround
Disable the "Workbox - Common Plugin" and "Workbox - JIRA Provider Plugin" can help avoid running into the duplicate problem.
fields.summary: Broken Application Links will not be loaded instantly and will cause duplicate issues to be created

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Since Jira Issue Archiving can remove individual issues from the index, for _Users_ who are not aware of the archive, the JQL search might not return expected result(s) since those issues are not searchable.  

h3. Suggested Solution
At this point, we believe that _Users_ should contact _Jira Admin_ and clarify if issues were archived. 

The expectation is that _Jira Admins_ will only archive issues that are no longer needed.  
At this point, we believe it will confusing from UX perspective if we start displaying such a message.
 
h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: As a Jira user I would like to know if JQL might miss some archived issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you hover over dates in the History tab, the tooltip provides a relative date as displayed in the attached screenshot (history.png). This is different from what is displayed in the Comments tab, where an absolute date is displayed in alignment with [our documentation here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/configuring-the-look-and-feel-of-your-jira-applications-938846975.html#ConfiguringthelookandfeelofyourJiraapplications-Howtochangedateandtimeformats] (comment.png).
h3. Environment

Reproduced in 7.12 and 8.2
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Comment on an issue
 # Hover over the time in the Comment tab
 # Note the time displayed in the tooltip is absolute (comment.png)
 # Transition an issue
 # Hover over the time in the History tab
 # Note the time displayed in the tooltip is relative (history.png)

h3. Expected Results

It is expected that the tooltip would behave consistently and always display absolute times
h3. Actual Results

The tooltip output is different for various times.
h3. Workaround

Short of [disabling relative times completely|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/disable-relative-dates-in-jira-applications-414187622.html], there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Tooltips in History tab not displaying absolute times

fields.description:

When French is selected as the System Default Language, the menu item "Issues" is translated to "Tickets" instead of "Demandes".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a vanilla instance using 8.1.+
 # Change the system default language to French

h3. Expected Results
The item "Issue" at the menu bar should be translated to "Demandes" as was on 8.0.x

h3. Actual Results
The item "Issue" at the menu bar is translated to "Tickets"

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The "Issue" item on the menu is showing as "Tickets" instead of "Demandes" using French as default language

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a Jira instance has a user called 'Unassigned' then the assignee related searches get mixed up.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new user on the Jira instance
# Use the username 'Unassigned' and Full name and email as anything.

h3. Expected Results
Nothing should break and all searches should work normally.

h3. Actual Results
The searches for this Unassigned user and the unassigned issues get mixed up. 
Searching like {{assignee is EMPTY}} or {{assignee = Unassigned}} both show issues that are either unassigned or that are assigned to the 'Unassigned' user.
 
h3. Notes
Related KBs
* [Unassigned issues doesn't follow the swimlane configuration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/unassigned-issues-doesn-t-follow-the-swimlane-configuration-779158980.html]

h3. Workaround
Delete the user 'Unassigned' from the instance.
fields.summary: Creating a user named "Unassigned" causes issue assignees to be mixed up

fields.description:
Add Project restricted to Group functionality requirements:
1.	A Project can be associated with zero, one or many Groups
2.	A Group can be associated with zero, one or many Projects
3.	If a Project is not associated with a Group then the existing Permission scheme access applies
4.	Where a Project is associated to a Group/s then only members of that Group/s can access the Project (from any screen/area) and then the existing Permission scheme access is applied
fields.summary: Additional functionality to restrict a project to selected members of a global Group
Add project re-index specification to JIRA Indexing FAQ document

Currently, it is not possible to restrict Custom Field values based on the user groups. This makes it difficult to track Custom Field data which is specific to certain user groups.

h3. Workaround 
None

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some of the custom/system fields that are alphabetically last in order get hidden from the 'Configure field' dropdown in create/edit issue screen if there are lots of custom fields present on that screen.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Generated around 55 custom fields for a Project using Data Generator plugin and associated them with the default screen for issue creation.
 # Try creating a new issue or editing the existing issue by clicking on Edit button on the issue screen.
 # In the create/edit screen click on 'Configure Fields'-> All/Custom.
 # Some of the custom fields which are alphabetically last in order(starting with letter 'w' and 'v', can be seen in the screen recording) are missing from the dropdown. Enclosed some screenshots depicting this behavior:
 !image-2019-06-20-20-06-16-964.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
All the fields should be visible

h3. Actual Results
Some of the fields that are alphabetalically last in order are missing.

h3. Notes
Able to replicate this behavior on both version 7.13 and 8.2 on multiple browsers. Enclosed screen capture from Jira version 8.2 for this behavior.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Adding multiple custom fields hides some of the fields that are alphabetically last in the 'Configure fields' dropdown present on Edit/Create issue screen.

fields.description: It would be helpful in Jira Software to have an option to set an error message or email bounce message if a user comments on a Closed ticket.
fields.summary: Optional Bounce/Error on closed ticket comments

fields.description:
Batch notification was [introduced in Jira 8|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjira/batching-email-notifications-960702680.html] to reduce the number of emails a user gets when issues are being updated. However, this setting is applied globally in a Jira instance. 

In some cases, a user might want to receive the individual notifications.

As the plan is to make batch notification a default configuration in the future, it would be great if a user can opt out from it.
fields.summary: Allow users to opt out from batch notification

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Jira needs to escape the URLs when it loads the issue table from a custom filter.

Currently it is sending the url with the brackets, should use the html escape codes instead.

It is forbidden to use square brackets in a URL (except to designate the host if it is an IP address). See the [reference|https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986#section-3.5]
 
A host identified by an Internet Protocol literal address, version 6
   [RFC3513] or later, is distinguished by enclosing the IP literal
   within square brackets ("[" and "]").  This is the only place where
   square bracket characters are allowed in the URI syntax. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Unable to export a filter and filter box is missing when viewing it in saved filters
#  Open configuration file server.xml (should be in conf directory)
# Find all connectors your application is using
# Add {{relaxedPathChars="[]|" relaxedQueryChars="[]|{}^\`"<>"}} to properties for example: 
{code:java}
<Connector port="8080" relaxedPathChars="[]|" relaxedQueryChars="[]|{}^\`"<>" maxThreads="150" minSpareThreads="25" connectionTimeout="20000" enableLookups="false" maxHttpHeaderSize="8192" protocol="HTTP/1.1" useBodyEncodingForURI="true" redirectPort="8443" acceptCount="100" disableUploadTimeout="true" bindOnInit="false"/>{code}
# Restart Jira
# Unable to browse URLs with "[" and "]" cause there's no way to escape the characters.

 !Screenshot_20190619_154447.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

Replace brackets in url cause they are not allowed in the URI syntax
Example URL:
https://domain_name/jira/rest/api/2/filter/12112?expand=subscriptions[-5:]&_=1560935888167

*(see part subscriptions[-5:] )*

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira needs to escape the URLs when it loads the issue table from a custom filter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In a Jira Service Desk or Jira Software project, the *Create linked issue* screen should automatically have the important fields populated in the screen namely:
- Project
- Issue Type
- Created issue (linktype/relation)
- Linked issues

In this bug, it appears that the Created issue linktype/relation dropdown field isn't populated with the default value. It should have selected _is blocked by_, as the default value.
{code}<select class="select" id="issuelinks-linktype" name="issuelinks-linktype">
                            <option selected="selected" value="is blocked by" >is blocked by</option>
...
                    </select>{code}

h3. Environment
* Reproducible in Jira 8.2.2
* Not reproducible in Jira 8.2.1
* Browsers: Google Chrome, Safari

h3. Steps to Reproduce
In a Jira Service Desk or Jira Software project, click a linked issue from *More > Create linked issue*.

h3. Expected Results
* All related fields above are populated

h3. Actual Results
* Created issue (issuelinks-linktype) field is empty
!issuelinks-linktype.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
Although this is not a required field, when a user overlooks at this, and quickly creates the linked issue, an error 500 is returned. This is expected, because the linktype is needed as the relation for a linked issue.
{code}
Request URL: <base-url>/secure/QuickCreateLinkedIssue.jspa?decorator=none&sourceIssueKey=ABC-123
Request Method: POST
Status Code: 500{code}

h3. Workaround
Manually select the Created issue linktype/relation from the dropdown.
fields.summary: Using 'Create linked issue' does not automatically populate the 'Created issue' linktype/relation field

fields.description:

Ref. [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/changes-in-the-improved-interface-961780550.html] --> See "*Managing capacity*"

I request the possibility to configure individual team member capacity in Portfolio 3.x

Thank you
fields.summary: Portfolio 3.x: Restore individual team members hours

fields.description: When using the status macro, you can only select certain (category) colors. It would be useful to let the statuses look exactly like the Jira statuses (colors and font type/family).
fields.summary: Status colours like Jira Cloud

fields.description:
h2. Issue Summary

When an admin creates a user with mixed case characters in JIRA and decides to rename the said user to all lower case, JIRA maintains the mixed case character when he clicks save after making the changes.

h2. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a use with username: William.Shakespeare
# Edit the user and update username to: william.shakespeare
# Save your changes.

h2. Expected Result

New username will take effect.

h2. Actual Result

On the JIRA UI, the username will still appear as William.Shakespeare

h2. Affected Version

Tested on *JIRA 7.13.2*

h2. Workaround

Give the user a new username entirely:
# Original username: William.Shakespeare
# New Username: william.shakespeare.change
# Actual Username: william.shakespeare
# Save your change.

This is the only way I found to be able to edit the user to fix the username.
fields.summary: Username Rename not working properly

fields.description:
Currently, JIRA will show all available projects where the user has "Create Issue" permission during issue creation. If user only have "Create issue" permission, user will be able to create issue but will not be able to view the issue due to the lack of "Browse project" permission.

h4. Suggestion
When creating an Issue – the drop down list of available projects is to be filtered to projects where the user has access to both the “Browse Projects” and “Create Issues” permissions.
fields.summary: When creating issue in JIRA, only show projects where user have Create issue and Browse Projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Under very specific circumstances Jira services may stop running due one thread awaiting a response from a DNS server. While there is a 10 second connection timeout by default it appears to be possible that a connection is established but the DNS server itself doesn't respond.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira mail handler
 # Have an unreliable DNS server

h3. Expected Results

The mail handler is timed out, fails, and other services continue running
h3. Actual Results

The mail handler thread continues to run, blocking all other service threads as shown
 !running-service-thread.png|thumbnail!

!locked-service-threads.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Restart Jira in order to restore services, including the mail handler service
fields.summary: DNS resolution can cause Jira services to stop running

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a node is suddenly terminated (ie not shutdown gracefully), {{ClusterManager}} API still return the terminated node as active

h3. Background

From the app developer
{quote}
I have 2 node cluster of JIRA 7.9.0 (node1, node2). Each node is a docker. When I turn off node2 by stopping the docker container the other node still sees second node as active.

I've checked that in {{clusternode}} table node2 is active. I've checked that in {{clusternodeheartbeat}} table beat data are not updated when node2 is down.

The way I am getting node data:
{code}
clusterManager.findLiveNodes();
return clusterManager.getAllNodes();
{code}

When instead of killing node2 I shut it down gracefully (/etc/init.d/jira stop), then node2 status in {{clusternode}} table is updated to OFFLINE.

Jira should make use of {{clusternodehearbeat}} table to determine whether node is OFFLINE

Tables data after node2 was terminated - not gracefully
2.1) clusternode
{code}
node_id,node_state,timestamp,ip,cache_listener_port,node_build_number,node_version
node1,ACTIVE,1559562446911,30b2e7efd175,40001,79000,7.9.0
node2,ACTIVE,1559834524044,bb7ae1186aa1,40001,79000,7.9.0
{code}
2.2) clusternodeheartbeat
{code}
node_id,heartbeat_time,database_time
node1,1560462378461,1560462378462
node2,1559852296782,1559852296782
{code}
3) I killed a note to simulate a failure in DC cluster. In my case I stopped a docker on which Tomcat with Jira node was placed.
{quote}

h3. Environment
7.9.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have 2 nodes
# Terminate node 2 instead of shutting down gracefully

h3. Expected Results
When node2 is down other nodes should see it as offline.

h3. Actual Results
When node2 is down other nodes see it as online.

h3. Notes
* I haven't personally replicated this. I'm moving this in this project for more expertise

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: ClusterManager reports node as Active when node is down

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Trailing whitespaces in the Single sign-on issuer field will break SAML authentication, resulting in an [Invalid Issuer in the Assertion Response|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/saml-login-fails-with-invalid-issuer-in-the-assertion-response-962344182.html].
h3. Suggested Solution
 * Strip leading and trailing spaces from the string entered in the Single sign-on issuer field.
fields.summary: Strip trailing whitespaces from the Single sign-on issuer field

fields.description:
h3. Problem:

The standard Javascript function Date.prototype.setFullYear gets overwritten by the "jira.webresources:calendar-lib" (file: Calendar.js) module in such a fashion that it breaks any other javascript code or framework that depends on its original behavior of the function.

This is a non-standard practice and should be deprecated by Jira.

Plugin developers spend lots of time trying to figure out a workaround to be able to access the original method.

h3. Workaround:
The original behavior of *Date.prototype.setFullYear*  is saved in *Date.prototype.__msh_oldSetFullYear*  so the user can just reassign the original value in his script.
fields.summary: Jira overrides Date.prototype.setFullYear by the "jira.webresources:calendar-lib", breaking the default Javascript functionality of the function

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When adding the description to a custom field, there is currently no option to specify the position of the custom field description. By default, it is added underneath the custom field.

For instances that icons as a description, it is preferable for the description to be added on the left or right of custom field. We would like for the ability to specify the custom field description to be a 'multi-select' list between selections of :
 * up
 * down
 * left
 * right
fields.summary: Ability to specify the position of a custom field description
